__compat.title: DSR/CPR
__compat.description: CSI 5n / CSI 6n — Device status / cursor position report

xterm.notes: VT100 feature, supported since earliest versions

kitty.notes: Supports DSR 5 (device status) and DSR 6 (cursor position)

wezterm.notes: DSR (CSI 5n) and CPR (CSI 6n) both supported

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:1429-1448, supports both DSR (CSI 5n) and CPR (CSI 6n)

alacritty.notes: CSI 5n and CSI 6n supported

iterm2.notes: Device status report (DSR) and cursor position report (CPR) fully implemented via VT100CSI_DSR token. Handles CSI 5n (status) and CSI 6n (cursor position).

vte.notes: Supports DSR parameter 5 (operating status) and 6 (cursor position report)

windows_terminal.notes: Supports DSR 5n (operating status) and DSR 6n (cursor position report)

konsole.notes: CSI 5n reports device status (ready), CSI 6n reports cursor position via CSI r ; c R

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:3535-3541. Supports both DSR 5n (status) and 6n (cursor position report).

cy.notes: DSR responds with CSI 0n, CPR responds with cursor position

ghostty.notes: Extended cursor position report (CSI ? 6n) not implemented; only standard CPR (CSI 6n) is supported

kitty.notes: DSR 6 with private parameter (?)

wezterm.notes: Only standard CPR is implemented, not DECXCPR

foot.notes: Only standard CPR is implemented, not extended DECXCPR

alacritty.notes: Only standard CPR (CSI 6n) supported, not extended

vte.notes: Extended cursor position report, always reports page 1

windows_terminal.notes: Extended CPR includes page number in response

konsole.notes: No implementation found for extended cursor position report (CSI ? 6 n)

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:3544-3547. Returns cursor position with ? prefix.

xterm_js.notes: Reports as CSI ? y ; x R

xterm.notes: VT100 feature, supported since earliest versions

kitty.notes: Responds with callback to on_da1

wezterm.notes: RequestPrimaryDeviceAttributes returns VT500 with capabilities

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:822-875, reports as VT220 with sixel and color support

alacritty.notes: Reports VT102 (ESC [?6c)

iterm2.notes: Primary device attributes (DA1) fully implemented with VT100CSI_DA token type. Reports various capabilities based on terminal type and emulation level.

vte.notes: Supports VT520 level with 132-column mode, sixel graphics (conditional), horizontal scrolling, color text, and rectangular editing

windows_terminal.notes: Reports conformance level 61 with extensions 4,6,7,14,21,22,23,24,28,32,42,52

konsole.notes: Reports VT220 with capabilities via CSI ? 62 ; 1 ; 4 c

mintty.notes: Implemented in write_primary_da() at src/termout.c:880. Reports different DA strings based on terminal type configuration (vt100-vt500).

xterm.notes: VT220+ feature, extended to VT100 in xterm

kitty.notes: Responds with >1;PRIMARY_VERSION;SECONDARY_VERSION c

wezterm.notes: RequestSecondaryDeviceAttributes returns VT220 with version 277

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:1627-1667, reports VT220 with version number

iterm2.notes: Secondary device attributes (DA2) fully implemented with VT100CSI_DA2 token type. Reports terminal version via reportSecondaryDeviceAttribute method.

vte.notes: Reports as VT100-ish (level 1) or VT525 (level 5) depending on build configuration

windows_terminal.notes: Reports VT100 terminal type (0) with version 10 (1.0)

konsole.notes: Reports secondary attributes via CSI > 1 ; 115 ; 0 c

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:3137-3143. Reports terminal ID 77 (mintty), decimal version, and Unicode version.

xterm.notes: VT400+ feature for Terminal Unit ID

wezterm.notes: RequestTertiaryDeviceAttributes returns DCS format

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:1854-1872, responds with 'FOOT' as unit ID

iterm2.notes: Tertiary device attributes (DA3) implemented with VT100CSI_DA3 token type. Requires VT level 400+ (iTermEmulationLevel400).

vte.notes: Reports terminal ID as '~VTE' encoded in hexadecimal

windows_terminal.notes: Reports terminal ID as 00000000

konsole.notes: Reports tertiary attributes with '~KDE' identifier via DCS ! | 7E4B4445 ST

mintty.notes: No implementation found for CSI = c (tertiary device attributes).

__compat.title: DECRQM
__compat.description: CSI ? Ps $ p — Request mode value

kitty.notes: Supports querying known terminal modes

wezterm.notes: Fixed flushing in version 20220408-101518-b908e2dd

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:2203-2219 and csi.c:629-673

vte.notes: Supports both ECMA and DEC mode queries

windows_terminal.notes: Supports extensive mode reporting including IRM, LNM, DECCKM, DECCOLM, DECSCNM, and many others

konsole.notes: No implementation found for DECRQM (CSI ? Ps $ p)
